data.title: Tim Henman 2023 – Net Worth, Salary, Personal Life and Endorsements
data.meta_description: Here's everything you need to know about the personal life, net worth, career of former British professional Tennis player Tim Henman
data.text:
Here’s everything you need to know about the personal life, net worth, career of former British professional Tennis player Tim Henman

Tim Henman Facts

Tim Henman Career

Tim Henman turned professional in 1993 and quickly rose through the ranks. He became known for his serve-and-volley style of play, which was a rarity in the modern game. Wimbledon, the most prestigious tennis tournament in the world, became Henman’s home turf.

Throughout his career, he was known for his consistent performances at Wimbledon, making him a beloved figure in British tennis. Henman reached the semifinals of all four Grand Slam tournaments at least once in his career. He made it to the semifinals of Wimbledon four times (1998, 1999, 2001, 2002), the French Open once (2004), the US Open once (2004), and the Australian Open once (2004).

Henman achieved a career-high singles ranking of World No. 4 in July 2002. He consistently remained in the top 10 of the ATP rankings for several years.

He was a key player for Great Britain in the Davis Cup. He played a crucial role in helping the British team achieve notable victories and gain promotion to higher divisions. Henman won a total of 11 ATP singles titles, including two prestigious ATP Masters Series titles (now known as ATP Tour Masters 1000): Paris (2003) and Cincinnati (2004).

Tim Henman represented Great Britain in three Olympic Games (Atlanta 1996, Sydney 2000, and Athens 2004), but he did not secure a medal in the individual events.

After enduring some injury setbacks in the latter part of his career, Tim Henman announced his retirement from professional tennis in September 2007. His retirement was met with widespread appreciation and respect from fans and fellow players alike. Tim Henman’s dedication, sportsmanship, and contributions to British tennis have left a lasting impact on the sport in his home country and earned him a special place in the hearts of tennis fans worldwide.

Tim Henman Net Worth and Salary

Tim Henman has an estimated Net Worth of US$12 million as of 2023. He has played at the professional level and won trophies from his teenage days. Hence, it is not a surprise that he has accumulated such a huge net worth. During his playing career, Nastase earned $11,635,542 million in prize money besides his earnings from endorsement and sponsorship deals. His career prize money contributes a major portion to his overall net worth.

Tim Henman Personal Life

Tim Henman was born on September 6, 1974 in Oxford, England. He is the son of Anthony Henman and Jane Henman. He has two brothers, Richard and Michael. He attended the Dragon School in Oxford before moving on to the Reed’s School in Surrey.

In 1999, Henman married his longtime girlfriend, Lucy Heald, and the couple has three children together. Apart from Tennis, Tim Henman enjoys playing golf and has participated in various celebrity golf events. He is also a big fan of football and supports the English football club Chelsea.

Tim Henman Endorsements

Tim Henman’s current list of sponsors are not known in the public domain. During his playing days, Henman used to be one of the most sought-after athletes. It is obvious that a top Tennis star like Henman must have had several lucrative sponsorship and endorsement deals in his pocket throughout his career. We will update Henman’s list of sponsors whenever we have further details.
